I took the liberty of retargeting this PR to the `fuel` branch (pull request #2796) to make the diff easier to look at. (I know we could click the link above, but I think this way we make sure everyone is looking at the same thing).

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw:
None of the models with space on their names can be inserted, but they can be downloaded from the site, try [this](https://staging.ignitionfuel.org/chapulina/models/Newton's%20craddle) for example:

~~~
[Err] [FuelModelDatabase.cc:204] Unable to download model[https://staging-api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/chapulina/models/Newton's craddle]
[Err] [FuelModelDatabase.cc:118] Missing model.config for model
~~~
content.html:
None of the models with space on their names can be inserted, but they can be downloaded from the site, try this for example:

[Err] [FuelModelDatabase.cc:204] Unable to download model[https://staging-api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/chapulina/models/Newton's craddle]
[Err] [FuelModelDatabase.cc:118] Missing model.config for model

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw:
I see that when I insert a model it shows up on `~/.ignition/fuel/models`, and it's cool that its download count increases on the site! 

But I noticed that the next time I insert the same model, the count increases again on the site. So I noticed that the time of the file creation is also changed, which means, we're always downloading a new model and not using the cached one. Should we be using the local copy after the 1st download?
content.html:
I see that when I insert a model it shows up on ~/.ignition/fuel/models, and it's cool that its download count increases on the site!

But I noticed that the next time I insert the same model, the count increases again on the site. So I noticed that the time of the file creation is also changed, which means, we're always downloading a new model and not using the cached one. Should we be using the local copy after the 1st download?

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw: That's a good point but I think it should be solved in Ignition Fuel Tools.
content.html: That's a good point but I think it should be solved in Ignition Fuel Tools.

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw:
I keep trying to insert [this](https://staging.ignitionfuel.org/chapulina/models/Number2) beautiful model with number 2 written on it, but Gazebo keeps converting the words to numbers :cry: 

![number2.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3602829637-number2.gif)

Ok, to be fair, I set the whole thing up and it's not really this pull request's fault. The problem is when Gazebo resolves the `model://number2/materials/textures` URI and finds the one for the model from [gazebo_models](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/605a402bd4c23232002b4a2ba7113ae885051bbe/number2/) which I had already cached on my machine. If I delete the cached model, then the model from Fuel is inserted correctly.

I believe the same problem happens to meshes.
content.html:
I keep trying to insert this beautiful model with number 2 written on it, but Gazebo keeps converting the words to numbers

Ok, to be fair, I set the whole thing up and it's not really this pull request's fault. The problem is when Gazebo resolves the model://number2/materials/textures URI and finds the one for the model from gazebo_models which I had already cached on my machine. If I delete the cached model, then the model from Fuel is inserted correctly.

I believe the same problem happens to meshes.

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw: I think there was some discussion about verifying hashes / checksums to see if the cached model needs to be updated with the one from the online db.
content.html: I think there was some discussion about verifying hashes / checksums to see if the cached model needs to be updated with the one from the online db.

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw: but I also remembered arguments against auto update as we would like to keep a history of model versions. I imagine we could then need to give users the option to click on Number2, which would then expand and list all versions available
content.html: but I also remembered arguments against auto update as we would like to keep a history of model versions. I imagine we could then need to give users the option to click on Number2, which would then expand and list all versions available

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw: I think the problem here is not really related to versions, but to 2 resources with the same URI. We have `model://number2/materials/textures` both on `gazebo_models` and and on Fuel, and Gazebo just chooses the first one it finds, no matter where `model.sdf` is coming from.
content.html: I think the problem here is not really related to versions, but to 2 resources with the same URI. We have model://number2/materials/textures both on gazebo_models and and on Fuel, and Gazebo just chooses the first one it finds, no matter where model.sdf is coming from.

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw:
Model [Number3](https://staging.ignitionfuel.org/chapulina/models/Number3) helps the point I'm trying to make. When you insert it, it uses the SDF from Fuel, which has a cylinder geometry, but the texture from gazebo_models:

![number3.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/933411432-number3.png)

In any case, it could be argued that the correct thing to do is to have different URIs for different resources, and I agree.
content.html:
Model Number3 helps the point I'm trying to make. When you insert it, it uses the SDF from Fuel, which has a cylinder geometry, but the texture from gazebo_models:

In any case, it could be argued that the correct thing to do is to have different URIs for different resources, and I agree.

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw: It seems like model needs some way to reference itself. `model://name/` isn't specific enough when there are multiple sources for models. Without that we're requiring `model://name/` to be globally  unique, and I don't think that's enforceable.
content.html: It seems like model needs some way to reference itself. model://name/ isn't specific enough when there are multiple sources for models. Without that we're requiring model://name/ to be globally unique, and I don't think that's enforceable.

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw:
Agreed. There's been talk of converting URIs in Fuel to full URLs like `<uri>https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/user/model</uri>`.

To be fair, this is an old issue in Gazebo, you can have the same problem with 2 models having the same name on different paths. But now that we're about to support multiple users uploading any model they want to the site, I think this will become a bigger problem.
content.html:
Agreed. There's been talk of converting URIs in Fuel to full URLs like <uri>https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/user/model</uri>.

To be fair, this is an old issue in Gazebo, you can have the same problem with 2 models having the same name on different paths. But now that we're about to support multiple users uploading any model they want to the site, I think this will become a bigger problem.

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw:
I'm getting a `[Msg] Waiting for model database update to complete...` msg if I try to insert a fuel's model before the old model database (gazebosim.org) has finished loading. 

The problem is to do with the [createEntity](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/fb56ebf1d7c47c2e696b310bcaa3f3f7b9a7cf9b/gazebo/gui/InsertModelWidget.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#InsertModelWidget.cc-304) event fired after locating the model. It triggers other places in gui to look for the model  in the old model database. Here's part of the backtrace leading up to that msg

~~~
Thread 1 "gzclient" hit Breakpoint 1, gazebo::common::ModelDatabase::GetModels[abi:cxx11]() (this=this@entry=0x7ffff7dcc0b0 <SingletonT<gazebo::common::ModelDatabase>::GetInstance()::t>) at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/ModelDatabase.cc:328
328	        gzmsg << "Waiting for model database update to complete...\n";
(gdb) bt
#0  gazebo::common::ModelDatabase::GetModels[abi:cxx11]() (this=this@entry=0x7ffff7dcc0b0 <SingletonT<gazebo::common::ModelDatabase>::GetInstance()::t>) at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/ModelDatabase.cc:328
#1  0x00007ffff6e46513 in gazebo::common::ModelDatabase::HasModel (this=this@entry=0x7ffff7dcc0b0 <SingletonT<gazebo::common::ModelDatabase>::GetInstance()::t>, _modelURI="model://beer/materials/scripts") at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/ModelDatabase.cc:153
#2  0x00007ffff6e46a59 in gazebo::common::ModelDatabase::GetModelPath (this=this@entry=0x7ffff7dcc0b0 <SingletonT<gazebo::common::ModelDatabase>::GetInstance()::t>, _uri="model://beer/materials/scripts", _forceDownload=_forceDownload@entry=true) at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/ModelDatabase.cc:412
#3  0x00007ffff6e71230 in gazebo::common::SystemPaths::FindFileURI (this=this@entry=0x7ffff7dcc380 <SingletonT<gazebo::common::SystemPaths>::GetInstance()::t>, _uri="model://beer/materials/scripts") at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/SystemPaths.cc:320
#4  0x00007ffff6e70066 in gazebo::common::SystemPaths::FindFile (this=this@entry=0x7ffff7dcc380 <SingletonT<gazebo::common::SystemPaths>::GetInstance()::t>, _filename="model://beer/materials/scripts", _searchLocalPath=_searchLocalPath@entry=true) at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/SystemPaths.cc:344
#5  0x00007ffff6e28cf7 in gazebo::common::find_file (_file="model://beer/materials/scripts") at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/CommonIface.cc:153
#6  0x00007ffff6e28e6b in gazebo::common::find_file_path (_file="model://beer/materials/scripts") at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/CommonIface.cc:165
#7  0x00007ffff5071bb1 in gazebo::rendering::RenderEngine::AddResourcePath (this=this@entry=0x7ffff7dcafe0 <SingletonT<gazebo::rendering::RenderEngine>::GetInstance()::t>, _uri="model://beer/materials/scripts") at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc:471
#8  0x00007ffff50e0fa4 in gazebo::rendering::Visual::Load (this=0x5695dd0) at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc:474
#9  0x00007ffff50ccbd2 in gazebo::rendering::Visual::Load (this=this@entry=0x5695dd0, _sdf=std::shared_ptr (count 3, weak 3) 0x56513c0) at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc:341
#10 0x00007ffff72bba82 in gazebo::gui::ModelMaker::CreateModelFromSDF (this=this@entry=0x18ca560, _modelElem=std::shared_ptr (count 5, weak 2) 0x5487c30) at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/gui/ModelMaker.cc:285
#11 0x00007ffff72bda87 in gazebo::gui::ModelMaker::Init (this=this@entry=0x18ca560) at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/gui/ModelMaker.cc:213
#12 0x00007ffff72be350 in gazebo::gui::ModelMaker::InitFromFile (this=0x18ca560, _filename="/home/docker/.ignition/fuel/models/chapulinaaa/beer/model.sdf") at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/gui/ModelMaker.cc:120
#13 0x00007ffff7237005 in gazebo::gui::GLWidget::OnCreateEntity (this=0x171f420, _type="model", _data="/home/docker/.ignition/fuel/models/chapulinaaa/beer/model.sdf") at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/gui/GLWidget.cc:1010
~~~

You maybe able to just put an `#ifdef` around [this line in common::SystemPaths::FindFileURI](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/fb56ebf1d7c47c2e696b310bcaa3f3f7b9a7cf9b/gazebo/common/SystemPaths.cc?at=fuel_download&fileviewer=file-view-default#SystemPaths.cc-320) and see if that fixes the problem
content.html:
I'm getting a [Msg] Waiting for model database update to complete... msg if I try to insert a fuel's model before the old model database (gazebosim.org) has finished loading.

The problem is to do with the createEntity event fired after locating the model. It triggers other places in gui to look for the model in the old model database. Here's part of the backtrace leading up to that msg

Thread 1 "gzclient" hit Breakpoint 1, gazebo::common::ModelDatabase::GetModels[abi:cxx11]() (this=this@entry=0x7ffff7dcc0b0 <SingletonT<gazebo::common::ModelDatabase>::GetInstance()::t>) at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/ModelDatabase.cc:328

#3  0x00007ffff6e71230 in gazebo::common::SystemPaths::FindFileURI (this=this@entry=0x7ffff7dcc380 <SingletonT<gazebo::common::SystemPaths>::GetInstance()::t>, _uri="model://beer/materials/scripts") at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/SystemPaths.cc:320
#4  0x00007ffff6e70066 in gazebo::common::SystemPaths::FindFile (this=this@entry=0x7ffff7dcc380 <SingletonT<gazebo::common::SystemPaths>::GetInstance()::t>, _filename="model://beer/materials/scripts", _searchLocalPath=_searchLocalPath@entry=true) at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/SystemPaths.cc:344

#6  0x00007ffff6e28e6b in gazebo::common::find_file_path (_file="model://beer/materials/scripts") at /home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/CommonIface.cc:165

content.raw:
this is how I'm testing:

~~~
rm -fr ~/.gazebo/models/ambulance/
rm -fr ~/.ignition/fuel/models/
GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/docker/.ignition/fuel/models/iche033 gazebo --verbose
~~~

I expand `https://staging-api.ignitionfuel.org` under `Insert` tab and choose to insert `Ambulance` model then I see the message. If I already have the ambulance model in `~/.gazebo/models` directory then I dont' get the message
content.html:
this is how I'm testing:

rm -fr ~/.gazebo/models/ambulance/
rm -fr ~/.ignition/fuel/models/
GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/docker/.ignition/fuel/models/iche033 gazebo --verbose

I expand https://staging-api.ignitionfuel.org under Insert tab and choose to insert Ambulance model then I see the message. If I already have the ambulance model in ~/.gazebo/models directory then I dont' get the message

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw:
It should be possible to set the path at runtime calling `common::SystemPaths::Instance()->AddModelPaths`. Or to use [SaveDialog::AddDirToModelPaths](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/bcbea7608b1ad88067ef652e8e7a4b93ec1001cf/gazebo/gui/SaveEntityDialog.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#SaveEntityDialog.cc-383) to both update the current model paths and add the path to `gui.ini` so the model is usable the next time the user opens Gazebo, without the need for any manual path setting.

This could be set the moment the file is downloaded, I think we have all the necessary info to deduce the local download directory, right?
content.html:
It should be possible to set the path at runtime calling common::SystemPaths::Instance()->AddModelPaths. Or to use SaveDialog::AddDirToModelPaths to both update the current model paths and add the path to gui.ini so the model is usable the next time the user opens Gazebo, without the need for any manual path setting.

This could be set the moment the file is downloaded, I think we have all the necessary info to deduce the local download directory, right?

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw:
I'm here wondering if we've covered all our bases regarding Ignition Fuel for Gazebo 9. I think there is still some work to be done to improve inserting models through the GUI, support locating resources when playing back log files, opening saved worlds, or loading models directly from a world file (`<uri>` tags). Also regarding some of the older comments in this PR, I think we need a game plan on how to handle Fuel URIs as [discussed here](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/FUEL-74).

I think it will be easier to tackle these within Gazebo9 if we don't install the `FuelModelDatabase` headers, is it ok to do that?
content.html:
I'm here wondering if we've covered all our bases regarding Ignition Fuel for Gazebo 9. I think there is still some work to be done to improve inserting models through the GUI, support locating resources when playing back log files, opening saved worlds, or loading models directly from a world file (<uri> tags). Also regarding some of the older comments in this PR, I think we need a game plan on how to handle Fuel URIs as discussed here.

I think it will be easier to tackle these within Gazebo9 if we don't install the FuelModelDatabase headers, is it ok to do that?

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw:
Agreed, this PR is another step in the direction of supporting Fuel but it didn't pretend to tackle all issues.

I can modify the CMakeLists.txt for not installing the FuelModelDatabase headers, no problem. 

I'm still waiting for Jenkins to find out if CI is happy.
content.html:
Agreed, this PR is another step in the direction of supporting Fuel but it didn't pretend to tackle all issues.

I can modify the CMakeLists.txt for not installing the FuelModelDatabase headers, no problem.

I'm still waiting for Jenkins to find out if CI is happy.
